qas.question: What have classical trained performers done extensively?
What does a B.mus. or M.mus. degree include?
To what level is training for classical music often required?

context: Performers who have <a0_0>studied classical music<a0_0/> extensively are said to be "classically trained". This training may be from private lessons from instrument or voice teachers or from completion of a formal program offered by a Conservatory, college or university, such as a B.mus. or M.mus. degree (which includes <a1_0>individual lessons from professors<a1_0/>). In classical music, "...extensive formal music education and training, often to <a2_0>postgraduate<a2_0/> [Master's degree] level" is required.
